case_title: MUHAMMAD SHARIF and others vs DISTRICT OFFICER and others

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Sharif
allegation: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector
accussed_details.land_details: Lot No.4, Sq. No.44, Killas Nos.15, 16, 25, Sq.No.45, Killas Nos.15 and 16, measuring 5 Acres, situated in Chak No.20-Gagh, Tehsil Shorkot

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Bakhsh (son of Mahmood)
allegation: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector
accussed_details.land_details: Sq. No.21, Killas Nos.4 to 8, 13 to 19, and 20, measuring 12 Acres 4 Kanals, situated in Chak No.19-Gagh Tehsil Shorkot

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Bakhsh (son of Allah Ditta)
allegation: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector
accussed_details.land_details: Sq. No.54, Killas Nos.18 to 25, measuring 64 Kanals, situated in Chak No.19-Gagh, Tehsil Shorkot

complaint_summary: Petitioners leased State land under Temporary Cultivation Lease Scheme but were denied proprietary rights due to lack of District Collector approval on auction proceedings.
investigation_summary: Petitioners' applications were rejected by District Collector citing absence of auction approval. Appeals were dismissed by EDO(R). Similar cases were resolved favorably for other lessees.
judgment_summary: Revision petitions accepted. Petitioners granted proprietary rights based on rule of consistency and fulfillment of scheme conditions. District Collector directed to process files and recover dues.
Decision_or_verdict: Petitions accepted; proprietary rights granted to petitioners.
legal_arguments: Petitioners were highest bidders and leased land in accordance with law.
Failure to obtain District Collector approval was fault of public functionaries.
Petitioners fulfilled all terms of the scheme and paid government dues regularly.
Rule of consistency applied based on similar cases resolved favorably.
assets: State land leased under Temporary Cultivation Lease Scheme
key_issues: Non-confirmation of auction proceedings by District Collector
Application of rule of consistency in granting proprietary rights

maxims.Consistency: Two groups of persons similarly placed cannot be treated differently.

legal_terms.Proprietary Rights: Legal ownership rights granted to lessees under a scheme.

words_and_phrases.Rule of Consistency: Legal principle requiring similar treatment for similarly placed individuals.

summary_vector_notes: Revision petitions accepted due to rule of consistency and fulfillment of scheme conditions. Petitioners granted proprietary rights despite procedural lapses by public functionaries.

leases.land_details: Lot No.4, Sq. No.44, Killas Nos.15, 16, 25, Sq.No.45, Killas Nos.15 and 16, measuring 5 Acres, situated in Chak No.20-Gagh, Tehsil Shorkot
Sq. No.21, Killas Nos.4 to 8, 13 to 19, and 20, measuring 12 Acres 4 Kanals, situated in Chak No.19-Gagh Tehsil Shorkot

leases.lessee: Muhammad Bakhsh son of Allah Ditta
leases.land_details: Sq. No.54, Killas Nos.18 to 25, measuring 64 Kanals, situated in Chak No.19-Gagh, Tehsil Shorkot

facts.policy_extension: Lease periods were extended under policy instructions of the Colonies Department, Board of Revenue, Punjab.

government_notification.purpose: Grant proprietary rights to lessees of State land under Temporary Cultivation Lease Scheme.

legal_issues.rejection_reason: Original auction proceedings lacked approval of the District Collector.

petitioners_arguments.highest_bidders: Petitioners were highest bidders and leased land in accordance with law/policy.
petitioners_arguments.collector_approval: Failure to obtain District Collector approval was the duty of public functionaries, not petitioners.
petitioners_arguments.cultivation_history: Petitioners have cultivated the land for years and paid government dues regularly.
petitioners_arguments.similar_cases: Other lessees in identical cases were granted proprietary rights.

court_findings.rule_of_consistency: Petitioners must be treated similarly to other lessees granted proprietary rights.
court_findings.collector_approval_issue: Non-approval of allotment by District Collector is not the fault of petitioners.

superior_court_precedents.principle: Non-approval of allotment by District Collector does not disqualify lessees who fulfilled other conditions.
Similarly placed groups cannot be treated differently under law.

order.directive: District Collector to process files and recover outstanding dues including cost of land as per policy instructions.
